questions.explanation: Not getting enough sleep is a cause of poor driving behavior. Just like drugs and alcohol, sleepiness slows reaction time, decreases awareness, and impairs judgment.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Low ground railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the overpass ahead has a low clearance. You should not proceed if your vehicle is taller than the height shown on the sign (in this case, 13 feet 6 inches).

questions.question: Trucks' blind spots are:
questions.answerB: On the immediate left of the cab.
questions.answerC: Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.
questions.explanation: A truck's blind spots are much larger than a smaller car’s blind spots. The driver cannot see your car behind their vehicle and you can't see what’s happening in traffic ahead if you're driving too closely behind the truck. Whether you are driving behind or to the side of the truck, if you can’t see the driver’s face in their side view mirror, then they can’t see you.

questions.question: The faster the speed of your vehicle, the longer it takes to stop when you must react to other drivers' unexpected movements.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: The faster you are driving, the longer it will take for you to stop to react to other drivers' unexpected moves.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?
questions.answerA: Blind spots are eliminated if you have one outside mirror.
questions.answerB: Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
questions.answerC: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: Even if a vehicle is properly equipped with rearview and outside mirrors, it still has blind spots that cannot be seen in the mirrors. Large trucks have much larger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.

questions.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: A triangular red and white yield sign means that you must decrease speed as you approach an intersection and yield the right-of-way to any vehicles or pedestrians in the intersection. You must be prepared to stop if conditions require it.

questions.question: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:
questions.answerA: Move to the left of the center lane.
questions.answerB: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.
questions.answerC: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
questions.answerB: Always stop.
questions.answerC: Divided highway ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: Drivers may not pass from either side of a ____ centerline.
questions.answerB: Single broken yellow
questions.answerC: Double solid yellow
questions.explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-way road means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the center to pass.

questions.question: When should drivers yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in a crosswalk?
questions.answerA: Only if the pedestrians first wave to the driver.
questions.answerB: Only if the pedestrians are not texting while walking.
questions.answerC: At all times.
questions.explanation: Bring your vehicle to a complete stop at a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to any vehicle or pedestrian already in the intersection. You may carefully proceed if your lane is completely clear.

questions.question: Before switching on the ignition, you should:
questions.answerB: Be sure all passengers have buckled their safety belts.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Develop a routine for entering and leaving your car. Before switching on the ignition, buckle your safety belt and see that all passengers do likewise.

questions.question: A seat belt should be adjusted so that it:
questions.answerB: Is buckled snugly across your hip bones and lower abdomen.
questions.answerC: Is hidden beneath the seat.
questions.answerD: Keeps the seat belt buzzer or light from operating.
questions.explanation: Lap belts should fit snugly across your hip bones and the lower part of your abdomen. Shoulder belts should sit comfortably so that you can insert your fist between the belt and your chest.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection and your view to the side is blocked, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and look both ways.
questions.answerB: Maintain your speed and look both ways.
questions.answerC: Stop, then inch forward until you can see clearly in both directions.
questions.explanation: Drivers must slow down when approaching an intersection. If a clear view of cross traffic is obscured, a driver should come to a stop and inch forward until they can see clearly in both directions.

questions.question: A regulatory sign containing a red circle with a slash through the middle indicates:
questions.answerA: That drivers should come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: That an action is forbidden.
questions.answerC: That some drivers should yield to other drivers.
questions.answerD: That drivers should drive under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Some regulatory signs prohibit certain actions. These signs are rectangular and white with red and black markings. A red circle and slash on top of a black symbol indicates that the specified action is forbidden.

questions.question: At a railroad crossing, you must:
questions.answerA: Watch for vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings (school buses, trucks carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
questions.answerB: Watch for multiple trains.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: You must approach all railroad crossings with extreme caution and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction. Be aware of vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings, such as school buses and trucks carrying hazardous materials.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Curve.
questions.answerC: Turn right or left.
questions.answerD: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.explanation: This one-way sign indicates that traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Divided highway starts.
questions.answerC: Divided highway ends.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the divided highway ends ahead. Prepare to change lanes or shift lane position.

questions.question: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.
questions.answerB: Eating foods high in fat
questions.answerC: Time
questions.explanation: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

questions.question: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?
questions.answerA: Call your insurance company when you get home.
questions.answerB: Wait for the owner to return.
questions.answerC: Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hit a parked vehicle or other property, you must leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to the vehicle or property that you hit.

questions.question: When riding in a vehicle, small children:
questions.answerA: May be safely held by a strong adult.
questions.answerB: Will be safe if they are standing on the floor in the back of the vehicle.
questions.answerC: Will not be hurt in an accident because they are small.
questions.answerD: Must never be allowed to ride while standing in the vehicle.
questions.explanation: Special child seats are available for children who are too small to wear regular safety belts. No person is strong enough to safely hold onto a child of any size during an accident or sudden stop. Never allow a child to ride in a vehicle unless they are properly fastened into a seat.

questions.question: Highways and roads freeze before ramps and bridges.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Ramps and bridges are suspended in the air, causing them to become icy very quickly in cold weather. Drive with extra caution when crossing a bridge in freezing temperatures.

questions.question: When you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an approaching emergency vehicle, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down until it passes you.
questions.answerB: Drive to the right side of the road and stop.
questions.answerC: Motion for the emergency vehicle to pass you.
questions.answerD: Merge into the right lane and continue driving.
questions.explanation: Yield the right-of-way to any approaching emergency vehicle that is using its flashing lights or siren, regardless of its direction of travel. You must immediately drive to the right side of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, pass through the intersection before coming to a stop on the right side of the road.

questions.question: When you drive through an area where children are playing, you should expect them:
questions.answerA: To know when it is safe to cross the street.
questions.answerB: To stop at the curb before crossing the street.
questions.answerC: To run out in front of you without looking.
questions.answerD: Not to cross the street unless they are with an adult.
questions.explanation: You should always reduce your speed and use extra caution when children are in the vicinity. They may fail to understand the danger and may run out in front of you without looking.

questions.question: While backing, you should:
questions.answerB: Flash your lights.
questions.answerC: Open your door to see if it is safe to proceed.
questions.answerD: Turn your head and look through the rear window.
questions.explanation: When intending to back up, always check behind your vehicle before getting in. Children and small objects are difficult to see from the driver’s seat. While backing, turn your head so you can see through the rear window. Do not depend only on your mirrors or sensors.

questions.question: If two vehicles arrive to a four-way stop at the same time:
questions.answerA: The vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
questions.answerB: The vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
questions.answerC: Drivers must make hand motions to communicate with each other.
questions.answerD: One driver should proceed without stopping.
questions.explanation: In general, vehicles at a four-way stop should proceed in the order that they arrive. However, if two vehicles arrive to the intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the left must yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on the right.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Look for a train station ahead.
questions.answerB: Signal before going any further.
questions.answerC: Slow down and yield for trains.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing on the road ahead. You should always slow down when approaching a railroad crossing. Trains cannot yield to cars, so you must let them pass before crossing the tracks.

questions.question: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerB: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.
questions.explanation: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: A series of curves is ahead.
questions.answerC: An S-curve is ahead.
questions.answerD: The road will be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that especially slippery conditions exist when the road is wet.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.answerB: Traffic light ahead.
questions.answerC: Do not pass.
questions.explanation: Solid yellow lines on two-lane roads indicate zones where passing is prohibited. If a solid yellow line appears next to a broken yellow line, drivers in the lane nearest to the solid yellow line may not pass. In some instances, both yellow lines will be solid, indicating that it is not safe to pass from either direction.

questions.question: A steady red arrow displayed on a traffic light means:
questions.answerA: Drivers cannot turn in the indicated direction.
questions.answerB: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction after coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction.
questions.explanation: If a traffic signal is displaying a steady red arrow, traffic in the indicated lane may not proceed in the direction shown by the arrow. Drivers must come to a full stop and wait for a green signal to proceed.

questions.question: You are driving when your power steering stops working. You should:
questions.answerA: Honk your horn and turn off the ignition.
questions.answerB: Turn on your hazard lights and brace yourself.
questions.answerC: Work hard to steer, reduce your speed, drive to a safe area, and stop.
questions.explanation: If your power steering stops working, additional effort will be required to maintain steering control. Reduce your speed and pull off the roadway to stop in a safe area.

questions.question: If an approaching train is near enough or going fast enough to be a danger, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerB: Not cross the tracks until the train has completely passed.
questions.answerC: Cross the tracks at your own risk.
questions.answerD: Find an alternative route across tracks.
questions.explanation: You should look and listen for trains before crossing any railroad tracks. If an approaching train is near enough or going fast enough to be a danger, you cannot go across the tracks. This is true even if they have no signals or the signals are not working.

questions.question: If you need to slow down while driving on a slippery road, the first thing you should do is:
questions.answerB: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Apply your parking brake.
questions.explanation: To slow down on a slippery road, you should first take your foot off the gas pedal. If you need to slow down even more, gently apply a slow, steady pressure to your brake pedal.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Do not pass trucks.
questions.answerC: Truck parking area ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of the presence of a hill ahead.

questions.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slants in to the left. That shows that:
questions.answerA: There is an intersection just ahead.
questions.answerB: You are approaching a construction area.
questions.answerC: You will be required to turn left just ahead.
questions.explanation: A solid line along the side of the road indicates where its edge is, marking the boundary between the travel lane and the shoulder. If the edge line angles toward the center of the road, this means that the road is narrower ahead.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: No right turn.
questions.answerC: All traffic must go straight ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection ahead. A road joins from the right.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
questions.answerB: Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
questions.answerC: Using your side mirror.
questions.explanation: Even if your vehicle is properly equipped with mirrors, there are blind spots that cannot be seen by using the mirrors. Before changing lanes, look over your shoulder to check these areas.

questions.question: You may drive around the gates at a railroad crossing:
questions.answerB: Under no circumstances.
questions.answerC: When the lights have stopped flashing.
questions.answerD: When other drivers drive around the gates.
questions.explanation: You are required to stop at all railroad crossings when signals warn of an approaching train. These signals may include flashing red lights, a lowered crossing gate, a flagger signaling, or a train’s audible signal of warning. Do not attempt to go around a lowered gate.

questions.question: Who must yield when a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light?
questions.answerB: The driver
questions.answerC: Whoever is slower
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians when they are crossing at any intersection without a traffic light, whether or not there is a crosswalk.

questions.question: Stopping distances and severity of crashes:
questions.answerB: Are not affected by vehicle speed.
questions.answerC: Increase as vehicle speed increases.
questions.explanation: Stopping distances are longer and crashes are more severe when traffic travels at higher speeds.

questions.question: If you are driving near a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane.
questions.answerB: Drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
questions.answerC: Allow the motorcycle to use only half of a lane.
questions.answerD: Pass using the same lane as the motorcycle.
questions.explanation: A motorcycle is a full-size vehicle with the same privileges as any other vehicle on the roadway. You should allow a motorcyclist a full lane width. Although it may seem as though there is enough room in the traffic lane for a larger vehicle and a motorcycle, remember that the motorcycle needs room to maneuver safely.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:
questions.answerA: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead than you can.
questions.answerB: Farther behind the truck than you would when following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerC: No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.
questions.explanation: When you follow so closely behind a truck that you cannot see the truck driver’s side view mirrors, the trucker cannot see you and has no way of knowing you are there. Tailgating a truck, or any vehicle, is dangerous because you take away your own cushion of safety if the vehicle in front of you stops quickly.

questions.question: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.
questions.answerB: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.
questions.answerC: Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.
questions.explanation: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.answerB: Intersection.
questions.answerC: Lane change.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers?
questions.answerA: They know other drivers will do the right thing.
questions.answerB: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.
questions.answerC: They expect no breaks and give none.
questions.explanation: Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

questions.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:
questions.answerA: You first come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: You wait until the light changes.
questions.answerC: You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
questions.explanation: If you are in a lane corresponding to a signal displaying a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow when the way is clear. This is true whether the arrow is displayed alone or together with another signal.

questions.question: If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals for you to stop, you should:
questions.answerB: Obey the traffic signal.
questions.answerC: Do what the vehicle in front of you does.
questions.explanation: Drivers must obey any instructions given by a police officer, even if the instructions contradict laws, signs, signals, or markings that would otherwise apply.

questions.question: You are required by law to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles of a change of address within ____ of the change.
questions.answerB: 30 days
questions.answerC: 90 days
questions.explanation: Drivers who change their address are required to update their information with the Department of Motor Vehicles within 60 days of the change.

questions.question: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
questions.answerA: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
questions.answerB: At the legal speed limit.
questions.answerC: More slowly than the freeway traffic.
questions.explanation: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

questions.question: When you hear a fire engine siren behind you, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down until it passes you.
questions.answerB: Drive with your flashers on.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the side of the road and stop.
questions.answerD: Speed up and take the nearest exit.
questions.explanation: When you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, you must pull over to the curb or side of the road and stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Hill ahead.
questions.answerC: Truck stop ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should:
questions.answerB: Use your parking lights.
questions.answerC: Use your low beam headlights.
questions.explanation: Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about driving on a wet roadway?
questions.answerA: As you drive faster, your tires become less effective.
questions.answerB: Water does not affect cars with good tires.
questions.answerC: Deep water is less dangerous than shallow water.
questions.answerD: As you decrease your speed, the roadway becomes more slippery.
questions.explanation: The faster you drive on a wet roadway, the less effective your tires will be at wiping the water from the road. If your speed becomes excessive enough, your tires will lose their grip on the road entirely and you will begin to hydroplane (that is, to slide down the road on a film of water).

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop and go when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.
questions.answerD: Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road.
questions.explanation: A stop sign means that you must come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians in or heading toward the intersection. Go again when it is safe.

questions.question: A telltale sign of a drunk driver is:
questions.answerB: They are driving more slowly than the normal traffic flow.
questions.answerC: They are making quick and sudden stops.
questions.explanation: Telltale signs of drunk driving include speeding, weaving, driving more slowly than the normal traffic flow, making jerking motions, and making quick and sudden stops.

questions.question: You may not park within ____ of an alley entrance, public driveway, or private driveway.
questions.answerB: 20 feet
questions.answerC: Five feet
questions.explanation: Vehicles, occupied or not, may not stand or park within five feet of an alley entrance, public driveway, or private driveway.

questions.question: You are driving when it starts to sleet or snow. You should:
questions.answerA: Keep your windshield and mirrors clear.
questions.answerB: Allow additional distance between your vehicle and the vehicles that you are following.
questions.answerC: Approach all vehicles with caution.
questions.explanation: In snowy weather, keep your windshield and mirrors clear. Increase your following distance when driving in wet and cold weather because a slippery road surface will increase the distance needed for your vehicle to stop.

questions.question: A broken yellow line down the center of a road indicates that:
questions.answerB: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: When broken yellow lines separate the lanes of traffic on a two-lane roadway, any driver may pass when there is no oncoming traffic.

questions.question: When making a right turn on a green light, you must:
questions.answerB: Stop and look for nearby police cars.
questions.answerC: Yield to pedestrians.
questions.explanation: Unless a posted sign prohibits it, you may turn right or left at a steady green light. When turning, you must yield to other vehicles and pedestrians within the intersection.

questions.question: Fatigue increases the risk of:
questions.answerB: Being late for an appointment.
questions.answerC: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.
questions.explanation: Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerC: Curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: No right turn.
questions.explanation: Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited to make a right turn. It would be unsafe and unlawful to make a right turn at an intersection with this sign.

questions.question: If you want to get off the freeway but you have missed your exit, you should:
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn through the median.
questions.answerC: Pull onto the shoulder and back your car to the exit.
questions.answerD: Flag down a police officer for an escort back to your exit.
questions.explanation: If you miss your exit, you should take the next exit. Do not stop or back up on the highway, swerve across multiple lanes to try to make the exit at the last second, or cross over the median to turn around. All of these maneuvers are illegal and extremely dangerous.

questions.question: What is a "No zone?"
questions.answerB: A one-way traffic area
questions.answerC: The blind spot of a large vehicle
questions.answerD: An area designated for motor vehicles
questions.explanation: "No zones" are the large blind spots around trucks and other large vehicles. Drivers of smaller vehicles should avoid lingering in "No zones."

questions.question: You must yield for emergency vehicles:
questions.answerB: When you see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
questions.answerC: Only when other vehicles yield.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren or flashing lights.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerB: Interstate route sign.
questions.answerC: School crossing sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are normally diamond-shaped and yellow, although orange warning signs are used in work areas. Such signs warn that you are approaching a hazardous location or an area where special rules apply.

questions.question: When driving in fog:
questions.answerB: Use your low beams.
questions.answerC: Use your high beams.
questions.answerD: It makes no difference which lights you use.
questions.explanation: You should use low beam headlights when driving in fog, rain, or snow.

questions.question: If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
questions.answerA: To keep the front wheels straight.
questions.answerB: In the direction you want the vehicle to go.
questions.answerC: In the opposite direction of the skid.
questions.answerD: In any direction. It doesn't matter.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle goes into a skid, you should turn the steering wheel in the direction you want the vehicle to go. As soon as the vehicle begins to straighten out, turn the steering wheel back the other way.

questions.question: The best way to avoid a dangerous situation while driving is to:
questions.answerA: Know what is happening around your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Turn off the radio.
questions.answerC: Always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.
questions.explanation: Always be aware of what is happening around your vehicle. Constantly observing your surroundings to the front, sides, and rear of your vehicle will help you see problems that may require you to change speed or roadway position.

questions.question: Yield also means stop if you cannot merge safely into the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: In a situation requiring you to yield the right-of-way, you must also stop if you cannot merge safely into the flow of traffic.

questions.question: Never drive a vehicle through, around, or under any railroad gate or barrier.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Never drive through, around, or under gates or barriers at a railroad crossing. It is illegal and very dangerous.

questions.question: If you are turning onto a street with more than one lane traveling in your direction, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.answerB: Turn into the lane marked with an arrow.
questions.answerC: Turn into the middle lane.
questions.explanation: When turning onto a street with more than one lane moving in the direction that you are traveling, turn into the lane that is closest to your previous lane. Do not change lanes when turning.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: No U-turns.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

questions.question: You should yield to a pedestrian:
questions.answerA: Only if they are in a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: At all times, even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic laws.
questions.answerC: Only if the traffic lights are in the pedestrian's favor.
questions.explanation: Always be aware of pedestrians near your vehicle. You must do everything you can to prevent striking a pedestrian, regardless of the circumstances.

questions.question: When the road is marked with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line, with the broken line next to your lane, you may pass:
questions.answerB: If you are on an expressway.
questions.answerC: If traffic is clear.
questions.explanation: When there is a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line in the center of the road and the broken line is next to your lane, you may cross the lines to pass if there is no oncoming traffic.

questions.question: If you encounter an aggressive driver, you should:
questions.answerB: Get out of their way.
questions.answerC: Speed up.
questions.explanation: Drivers must respect and cooperate with all other road users and conform to specific rules in order to maintain order and to avoid crashes. When encountering an aggressive driver, it is safest to just get out of their way. Always avoid competing with other drivers.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?
questions.answerB: Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment
questions.answerC: Both of the above
questions.explanation: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

questions.question: A yellow and black diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns you about conditions on or near the road.
questions.answerB: Helps direct you to cities and towns ahead.
questions.answerC: Tells you about traffic laws and regulations.
questions.answerD: Tells you about road construction ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs, which tell you about conditions on or near the road ahead, are usually diamond-shaped with black symbols or words on a yellow background.

questions.question: When driving in fog or mist, never put your headlights on the high beam setting because:
questions.answerA: The light will reflect back into your eyes.
questions.answerB: Approaching vehicles might not see you.
questions.answerC: Vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
questions.explanation: In foggy or misty conditions, you should not use your headlights on their high beam setting because the light will be reflected back into your eyes.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:
questions.answerA: Cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
questions.answerB: See the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
questions.explanation: Before returning to your original lane after passing, you must make sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. When you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to the lane.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing, you should:
questions.answerB: Look for a train.
questions.answerC: Be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: When you see any signs indicating a nearby railroad crossing, you should slow down, look for a train, and be ready to stop. If the red warning lights are flashing or the gate is down, you must stop 15 to 50 feet before the railroad tracks. Do not try to go around the gate.

questions.question: When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
questions.answerB: Accelerate as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Back up slowly.
questions.answerD: Not move until another driver waves you on.
questions.explanation: A green light tells you that you can go through the intersection. However, you must first yield the right-of-way to traffic and pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
questions.answerA: Passing on the left is permitted from either direction.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid line.
questions.answerD: Passing is not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that passing is allowed from the lane on the side next to the broken line.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates), a driver should slow down, look, and listen.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: If a railroad crossing has no warning devices or only a crossbuck sign, you should slow down, look in both directions of the track, and listen for a train or railroad equipment. Only proceed with caution across the tracks when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a sharp turn to the right.
questions.answerB: The lane must turn right.
questions.answerC: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.
questions.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

questions.question: If worried, nervous, angry, or crying, a driver:
questions.answerA: Will drive no differently than they would if they were thinking more clearly.
questions.answerB: Can drive faster because they are more in touch with their senses.
questions.answerC: Should take the time to focus on driving before starting the engine.
questions.answerD: Should call a friend to vent while driving.
questions.explanation: You may not be able to drive well if you are worried, excited, crying, angry, or depressed. Emotions can distract you from your driving because your mind is focused on something else. Take time to calm down and get focused before driving.

questions.question: What color are pavement markings that separate traffic lanes moving in opposite direction?
questions.answerB: White
questions.answerC: Yellow and white
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used in the center of the road to separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: This sign tells a driver that:
questions.answerB: A police officer is ahead.
questions.answerC: A parking attendant is ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

questions.question: You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn. You should:
questions.answerA: Signal and keep your wheels turned to the left.
questions.answerB: Signal and keep your wheels straight.
questions.answerC: Flash your headlights so drivers will let you through.
questions.answerD: Drive around the rear of a car if it blocks you.
questions.explanation: You must always signal before turning or changing lanes. You should keep your wheels straight while waiting to make a left turn. If another vehicle hits you from behind, this ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic.

questions.question: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing yellow light. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop and wait for the light to change.
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn because the intersection is closed.
questions.answerC: Drive carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerD: Prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed through the intersection slowly and with caution. Scan your eyes across traffic in both directions.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Always insist on the right-of-way over a vehicle when using a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Never enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching.
questions.answerC: Enter a crosswalk at any time because it is the vehicle driver’s responsibility to stop.
questions.answerD: Use crosswalks only if they are convenient.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians should not enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching. Though pedestrians have the right-of-way in crosswalks, a vehicle approaching from a close distance may not have the time to stop before entering the crosswalk.

questions.question: If you are driving and the rear end of your car starts skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerB: Steer to the left.
questions.answerC: Tap your brakes lightly and shift into neutral.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle enters a skid, you should take your foot off of the brake and steer in the direction that you want to go. For example, if the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should steer to the left. This will help bring the front of the vehicle in line with the rear, thereby straightening out the vehicle's overall direction.

questions.question: If stopped by law enforcement while driving a motor vehicle in the District of Columbia, you are responsible for providing your valid driver license, vehicle registration, and proof of insurance.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: If stopped by law enforcement while driving a motor vehicle in the District of Columbia, you will be responsible for providing your valid driver license, vehicle registration, and proof of insurance. Failure to comply may result in a fine and/or arrest.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane closed ahead.
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that a traffic signal is ahead and drivers should prepare to react to a yellow or red light.

questions.question: A “No stopping” sign means that, unless directed to do so by a police officer, you may stop only:
questions.answerB: To avoid conflict with other traffic.
questions.answerC: To discharge passengers.
questions.explanation: A "No stopping" sign means you can only stop to obey a traffic signal, to obey a police officer, or to prevent a conflict with another vehicle.

questions.question: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:
questions.answerB: Turn your steering wheel into traffic.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel in the direction you want to go.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, remain calm. Steer in the direction that you want to go and try not to overcorrect.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Slow down and do not use your brakes.
questions.answerC: Slow down; slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

questions.question: There may be times when 10 mph is too fast for drivers to safely operate their vehicles.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Drive below the posted speed limit when safety demands it. Some traffic, weather, or visibility conditions may require you to drive as slowly as 10 miles per hour.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: The highway ahead curves only to the right.
questions.answerB: The highway ahead turns sharply to the right.
questions.answerC: The highway ahead curves to the right and then to the left.
questions.answerD: The highway ahead curves to the left and then to the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left.

questions.question: What is the purpose of rumble strips?
questions.answerA: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.
questions.answerB: They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.
questions.answerC: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.
questions.explanation: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

questions.question: You must stop for a school bus:
questions.answerA: That is parked on the shoulder of the road with no one in it.
questions.answerB: When it approaches you, even if its lights are not flashing.
questions.answerC: If you are both driving on a two-lane highway and its red lights are flashing.
questions.answerD: Whenever the driver waves at you.
questions.explanation: You must stop when approaching a school bus that is displaying flashing red lights while stopped to pick up or drop off children. On a two-lane road, traffic moving in both directions must stop and remain stopped as long as the red lights near the top of the bus are flashing and/or the stop arm on the left side of the bus is extended.

questions.question: When making a right turn, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield to pedestrians in the intersecting crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Be alert to vehicles ahead that are also turning right.
questions.answerC: Yield to bicyclists traveling between you and the side of the road.
questions.explanation: When making a right turn at an intersection, you must yield to pedestrians in the intersecting crosswalk. Check for and yield to any bicyclists between you and the side of the road. Be alert to other vehicles that are also turning right.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: No parking.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: When you see or hear an emergency vehicle coming, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately and let the vehicle pass.
questions.answerB: Drive as far toward the right side of the road as is safe and stop.
questions.answerC: Proceed slowly and permit the vehicle to pass.
questions.answerD: Keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: When driving on a two-lane roadway or undivided highway, you must yield to an emergency vehicle using its lights and/or siren, regardless of the direction from which it is approaching. Immediately drive as near as possible to the right side of the road and stop, taking care not to stop within an intersection.

questions.question: Excessive speed:
questions.answerA: Does not increase the chance of a crash.
questions.answerB: Increases your ability to react to a hazard.
questions.answerC: Often leads to high-risk decision-making.
questions.explanation: Excessive speed is one of the most common contributing factors to vehicle crashes. Excessive speed does not save time and often leads to high-risk decision-making.

questions.question: Stopping distances and the severity of collisions:
questions.answerA: Decrease as a vehicle's speed increases.
questions.answerB: Are not affected by a vehicle's speed.
questions.answerC: Increase as a vehicle's speed increases.
questions.explanation: Excessive vehicle speed can have disastrous effects. As a vehicle's speed increases, the potential impact of a collision also increases, elevating the possibility of serious injury and death. Increase your following distance as your speed increases to ensure that you will be able to stop safely if needed.

questions.question: When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive slowly enough that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.
questions.answerB: Turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles ahead of you.
questions.answerC: Keep the instrument panel lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.
questions.explanation: You should drive more slowly at night than during the day because it is not possible to see as far ahead at night. You should make sure that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.

questions.question: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery:
questions.answerA: If it has been raining several hours.
questions.answerB: If it has just begun to rain.
questions.answerC: If it has been raining for one to two hours.
questions.explanation: Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

questions.question: Pennant-shaped signs indicate:
questions.answerB: No passing zones.
questions.answerC: Speed limits.
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped signs usually indicate no passing zones. Text will also be on the sign to confirm that it is a no passing zone.

questions.question: Motorists should maintain a safe operating distance when driving near a cyclist.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Drivers must be especially careful when driving near a cyclist and should maintain a safe operating distance between their vehicle and the cyclist.

questions.question: The amount of alcohol in the blood is referred to as:
questions.answerB: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC).
questions.answerC: Rate of alcohol consumption (RAC).
questions.explanation: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a measurement of the percentage of alcohol in the blood. The higher the BAC number, the more impaired a person is.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and keep moving in your lane.
questions.answerB: Keep driving in your lane.
questions.answerC: Pull to the right curb and stop.
questions.explanation: When you see an emergency vehicle using its lights or hear it using its siren, you must immediately pull over to the curb or side of the road and stop.

questions.question: Your driver license can be revoked in the District of Columbia if you are convicted of a drug offense, even if it is not driving-related.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Your driver license can be revoked in the District of Columbia if you are convicted of a drug offense, even if it is not driving-related.

questions.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
questions.answerB: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.
questions.answerC: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

questions.question: Collisions are more likely to happen when:
questions.answerA: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.
questions.answerB: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.
questions.answerC: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

questions.question: If weather or light conditions require you to have your lights on while driving:
questions.answerB: Use your high beams.
questions.answerC: Use your low beams.
questions.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in foggy, snowy, or rainy conditions. Light from high beam headlights will reflect back, causing glare and making it even more difficult to see ahead.

questions.question: In which of the following ways can alcoholic beverages affect you?
questions.answerB: It gives you a feeling of false confidence.
questions.answerC: It impairs your thinking ability.
questions.explanation: Alcohol dulls the parts of your brain that control inhibition, judgment, and self-control. As a result, you may feel stimulated, lively, and a bit giddy or foolish after consuming alcohol. Alcohol also impairs your reaction time, coordination, and balance. Your vision and ability to judge distance suffers after alcohol consumption, making it difficult to react to your surroundings.

questions.question: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down by shifting into a lower gear.
questions.answerB: Ease your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Slow down by pumping the brakes quickly and firmly.
questions.explanation: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should ease your foot off the gas pedal and stay off the brakes. Do not try to stop or turn until your tires are gripping the road again.

questions.question: You are driving up a hill and are approaching a heavy truck from the rear. You should know that:
questions.answerA: The truck may be traveling at a speed slower than the posted speed limit.
questions.answerB: You may not be able to safely pass the truck.
questions.answerC: You may not be able to legally pass the truck.
questions.explanation: Drivers must be aware that large vehicles often travel at a speed slower than the posted speed limit, especially when driving on an incline, and should use caution when approaching a large vehicle from the rear. When on a hill with limited visibility, it is unlawful to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: Blind spots are:
questions.answerA: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.
questions.answerB: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.
questions.answerC: Traffic control devices.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

questions.question: A steady yellow traffic signal means that a ____ light will soon appear.
questions.answerB: Steady green
questions.answerC: Steady red
questions.explanation: A steady yellow light on a traffic signal indicates that a steady red light will soon appear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Crossroad ahead.
questions.answerC: Keep right.
questions.explanation: Traffic signs with three sides of equal length warn drivers to slow down when approaching an intersection and to be prepared to come to a complete stop to yield to other drivers or pedestrians. Drivers may proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When dealing with pedestrians, a driver must:
questions.answerA: Make sure the pedestrian is aware of their vehicle.
questions.answerB: Always yield the right-of-way, even if the pedestrian is in the wrong.
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way only when the pedestrian is legally entitled to it.
questions.answerD: Slow down and sound their horn near a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: You must do everything you can to prevent striking a pedestrian or another vehicle, regardless of the circumstances. It is the driver’s basic responsibility to be alert to pedestrians and to yield the right-of-way to all pedestrians, even if the pedestrian is crossing the street where they should not be.

questions.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:
questions.answerB: Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
questions.answerC: Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.
questions.explanation: Any time you come to a place where people may cross or enter your path, or where one line of traffic meets another, you should look to the left and right sides of your vehicle to make sure no one is coming.

questions.question: What does a single dashed white line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.answerB: Lanes move in opposite directions.
questions.answerC: Drivers may not pass.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic that are moving in the same direction. Dashed white lines may be crossed to pass or change lanes, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If a driver sees an animal on the roadway:
questions.answerB: The driver should honk their horn.
questions.answerC: The driver should pass the animal as closely as possible.
questions.answerD: The driver should be very cautious.
questions.explanation: Be very cautious any time you encounter an animal on the roadway. Pass the animal slowly to avoid startling or frightening it.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Merging traffic.
questions.answerC: Steep hill ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: The same thing as a yield sign.
questions.answerB: The light is about to turn green.
questions.answerC: The same thing as a stop sign.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

questions.question: Which lane must you be in before making a left turn from a one-way street?
questions.answerA: The lane nearest the left curb.
questions.answerB: The lane nearest the center of the street.
questions.answerC: The lane nearest the right curb.
questions.explanation: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. If you are making a left turn from a one-way street, this means that you would make the turn from the lane nearest to the left curb.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: You must turn right.
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. You cannot make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: You must not drive your vehicle at a speed greater than:
questions.answerB: A speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent.
questions.answerC: A speed that is safe for existing conditions.
questions.explanation: You must not drive at a speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent. You must drive at a speed that is appropriate for the area where you are driving, the type and condition of surrounding traffic, the presence of pedestrians, the weather, the quality of the road, and light conditions. You must drive within legal speed limits.

questions.question: The best way to tell if you are permitted to pass another vehicle is to see if:
questions.answerA: There is a flashing green light ahead.
questions.answerB: The road ahead is straight.
questions.answerC: The vehicle ahead signals that it is okay to pass.
questions.answerD: There are solid or broken lane markings.
questions.explanation: The presence of solid or broken lane markings down the center of a road is the best indication of whether or not passing is permitted in an area. On a two-lane highway, you may not pass another vehicle if your lane is directly next to a solid line. You may not pass within 100 feet of an intersection.

questions.question: Large vehicles have blind spots that can extend up to 200 feet directly behind the vehicle.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Large vehicles have blind spots that can extend up to 200 feet directly behind the vehicle. Do not tailgate a large vehicle as they will have no way of knowing that you are there.

questions.question: If you’re going to turn left onto a one-way street, you should complete the turn into:
questions.answerB: The lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.answerC: Either lane.
questions.explanation: You should always turn from the lane that is closest to the direction you want to go. Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.

questions.question: Children on bicycles should be given extra space by motor vehicle operators because:
questions.answerA: They do not have the same physical reflexes as adults.
questions.answerB: They are smaller and more difficult to see than adults.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Children are often the least predictable pedestrians and the most difficult pedestrians to see. Take extra care to look out for children, especially near schools, bus stops, playgrounds, parks, and ice cream trucks. Be aware of children riding bikes on the sidewalk, as they may come onto the road unexpectedly.

questions.question: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:
questions.answerA: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
questions.answerB: Look for a second train.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Even after a train passes, watch out for a second train approaching on any track. Do not proceed until all gates have been lifted and all warning signals have stopped flashing.

questions.question: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?
questions.answerB: Whenever it helps prevent collisions.
questions.answerC: Never. It confuses other drivers.
questions.explanation: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

questions.question: What kinds of drugs can affect your driving ability?
questions.answerB: Marijuana
questions.answerC: Cold remedies
questions.explanation: Many kinds of drugs can impair your ability to drive. This includes illegal drugs and legal prescription or over-the-counter medications. It can be a criminal offense to drive while impaired by any drug.

questions.question: Sudden wind gusts on highways:
questions.answerA: Generally affect only the movement of large vehicles.
questions.answerB: Only cause visibility problems.
questions.answerC: Can cause problems for all vehicles.
questions.explanation: While it can create special problems for large vehicles, strong wind can cause problems for all drivers. Wind can lower visibility by blowing dirt and dust into the roadway, but it can sometimes also physically move a vehicle.

questions.question: If you are facing a green traffic light but the intersection ahead is blocked by traffic, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn left and find another route.
questions.answerB: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
questions.answerC: Follow the other vehicles and enter the intersection.
questions.explanation: Even if you are facing a green traffic light, do not start across the intersection if there are other vehicles blocking your way. If you are caught in the intersection when the light changes to red, your vehicle will block cross traffic. You can get a ticket for blocking an intersection.

questions.question: On slippery roads, you should:
questions.answerB: Drive more quickly.
questions.answerC: Drive the speed limit, with caution.
questions.answerD: Not drive more quickly than 20 mph.
questions.explanation: You should slow down at the first sign of rain, snow, or sleet, all of which can create slippery road conditions. When conditions on the road are less than ideal, safety may require that you drive more slowly than the posted speed limit.

questions.question: A "Merging lanes" sign means drivers should be prepared to change lanes or allow other traffic to come into their lane.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: A "Merging lanes" sign indicates that two lanes of traffic going the same direction will soon merge into one lane. Drivers should be ready to either change lanes or allow other traffic to merge into their lane.

questions.question: Drivers must be careful when passing large vehicles and should avoid driving beside large vehicles for long periods of time.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Because large vehicles have large blind spots on both sides, you should avoid driving beside a large vehicle for a long period of time. It is safest for you to either drop back or move forward when you find yourself directly next to a large vehicle.

questions.question: If you maintain a valid license for a full calendar year without obtaining pointable moving violations, you may be eligible to receive a Good Point on your driving record.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: If you maintain a valid DC driver license for a full calendar year without obtaining pointable moving violations, you may be eligible to receive a Good Point on your driving record.

questions.question: Before changing lanes on a multilane highway, you should:
questions.answerB: Turn on your headlights.
questions.answerC: Reduce your speed.
questions.answerD: Check your mirrors and blind spots.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should look in your rearview and side mirrors to make sure no one is trying to pass you. You should also look over your shoulder to make sure that no one is in your blind spot.

questions.question: Road rage and aggressive driving may be reduced by:
questions.answerB: Obeying posted speed limits.
questions.answerC: Using proper turn signals.
questions.explanation: As an increasing number of drivers populate the roadways, road rage becomes more prevalent. To help prevent road rage, a driver should use proper turn signals, obey posted speed limits, and allow plenty of travel time.

questions.question: When passing a large vehicle, the driver of a small vehicle must be prepared for:
questions.answerB: Excess air pollution.
questions.answerC: Wind gusts produced by the large vehicle.
questions.explanation: Large vehicles can cause wind gusts with a force great enough to cause direction changes in smaller vehicles. Drivers of small vehicles should be prepared to take proper corrective steering action when approaching or passing large vehicles that are moving at or near maximum speeds.

questions.question: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:
questions.answerA: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.
questions.answerB: Avoid the puddle if possible.
questions.answerC: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.
questions.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead curves left, then right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead curves right, then left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left. You should slow down to be able to negotiate these curves safely.

questions.question: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the left.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the right.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

questions.question: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.
questions.answerB: Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.
questions.answerC: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

questions.question: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from:
questions.answerB: All windows.
questions.answerC: Just the windshield and passenger window.
questions.explanation: It is important that you are able to see clearly through all of your vehicle's windows, including the windshield. Remove all snow, ice, and frost from your vehicle's windows and mirrors before you start to drive.

questions.question: To avoid being blinded by the glare of oncoming headlights:
questions.answerA: Focus your eyes on the centerline of the road.
questions.answerB: Glance to the right side of the road.
questions.answerC: Focus your eyes straight ahead.
questions.explanation: Glancing back and forth between the right side of the road and the road directly ahead allows you to avoid the glare of oncoming headlights while still staying safely in your lane.

questions.question: Is it legal cross a double solid yellow centerline to pass?
questions.answerB: No.
questions.answerC: If there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: If the vehicle ahead of you is driving under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Two solid yellow lines down the center of a two-way road mean that neither lane of traffic may cross the lines, unless they are turning off of the roadway. A driver can cross double yellow lines when turning into or out of a driveway or entrance to a business. No passing is allowed over a solid yellow line.

questions.question: If you are driving in another driver's blind spot, you should:
questions.answerA: Move forward or drop back so the other driver can see you.
questions.answerB: Keep a steady pace.
questions.answerC: Stay in the driver's blind spot.
questions.answerD: Honk to let them know you are there.
questions.explanation: Do not drive in someone else’s blind spot. Move forward or drop back so that the other driver can see you.

questions.question: You may continue carefully through an intersection with a yellow light if:
questions.answerA: There is an emergency vehicle crossing your lane.
questions.answerB: There are pedestrians crossing.
questions.answerC: You are turning right.
questions.answerD: You are already within the intersection when the light changes to yellow.
questions.explanation: If a steady yellow light appears when you are already within an intersection, you should continue through the intersection carefully.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: One-way traffic.
questions.answerC: Limited parking.
questions.explanation: Circular traffic signs indicate upcoming railroad crossings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a railroad crossing and should be looking for signs of an oncoming train.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:
questions.answerA: Wait for the green light before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
questions.answerC: Stop before crossing the intersection.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers must slow down, be more aware, and proceed with caution. Be alert to crossing traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: A solid white line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines are used to separate traffic moving in the same direction. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: You are entering a freeway. Check traffic on the freeway by:
questions.answerA: Using your rearview and side mirrors.
questions.answerB: Using your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: When entering any roadway, you must be aware of traffic conditions. Use your side mirror and look over your shoulder to help you see and anticipate traffic when entering a freeway.

questions.question: Distracted driving may be caused by:
questions.answerB: Talking or texting on a cellular phone.
questions.answerC: Changing a radio station or CD.
questions.explanation: It is estimated that drivers make 200 decisions for every mile traveled, making it vital that drivers focus their full attention on the task of driving. Performing any additional task can create a dangerous distraction.

questions.question: All drivers and ____ are required by law to wear seat belts in a moving vehicle while in the District of Columbia.
questions.answerB: Any front seat passengers
questions.answerC: Passengers under the age of 18
questions.explanation: District of Columbia law requires drivers and all passengers to wear seat belts in passenger cars, trucks, tractors, multi-purpose vehicles, and passenger buses. These vehicles may not be operated unless the driver and each occupant is wearing a seat belt.

questions.question: Do not pass:
questions.answerB: When school bus lights are flashing.
questions.answerC: When approaching an intersection.
questions.explanation: You should never pass if there is an oncoming vehicle in the passing lane, if your view is blocked by a curve or hill, at an intersection, before or on a railroad crossing or bridge, or in any other no passing zone. Unless you are on the opposite side of a multilane roadway with a median or shared center turn lane, you may not pass a stopped school bus that has its flashing red lights activated.

questions.question: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.answerC: Bicycle store.
questions.explanation: This sign (with the arrow below) indicates the location of a bicycle crossing/path. Drive with caution around this sign because bicycles likely regularly cross or ride beside traffic in the area.

questions.question: After you have passed a vehicle moving in the same direction, it is safe to move back into the right lane:
questions.answerB: When you can no longer see the passed vehicle over your right shoulder.
questions.answerC: When you can see the entire front of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: When passing, you should not return to your original lane until you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror. Always check your blind spots before moving back into your original lane.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.answerB: Pass with caution.
questions.answerC: Do not pass.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line next to your lane means that passing is not permitted from your direction.

questions.question: After being pulled over by law enforcement, a driver should immediately exit the vehicle and quickly approach the officer’s squad car.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: If stopped by law enforcement, you should stay in your vehicle with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

questions.question: If a child is riding a bicycle near your vehicle:
questions.answerB: Expect the child to be in total control of the bicycle.
questions.answerC: Expect the unexpected.
questions.explanation: Children on bicycles are sometimes unpredictable. Young bicyclists are especially likely to make surprising changes in direction. Remember that children and bicycles are both small in stature and may become difficult to see.

questions.question: The best way to avoid loss of control under wet conditions is to increase your vehicle's speed.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: As you drive on a wet road, your tires may start to ride up on the surface of water, causing you to lose control of your vehicle. This is called hydroplaning. The best way to avoid hydroplaning is to lower your speed when driving under wet conditions.

questions.question: “Highway hypnosis” is a driving condition that can result from:
questions.answerA: Staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
questions.answerB: Frequent rest stops.
questions.answerC: Too much sleep the night before your trip.
questions.explanation: "Highway hypnosis” happens when you stare straight ahead at the roadway for long periods of time and stop actively scanning ahead, behind, and around your vehicle. This can lead you to zone out, making you very likely to crash into traffic slowing or stopping ahead of you.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?
questions.answerA: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones as they are under normal traffic conditions.
questions.answerB: You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."
questions.answerC: Slow down only if you think workers are present.
questions.explanation: Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

questions.question: If you are getting tired while driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.
questions.answerB: Drink something with caffeine.
questions.answerC: Open a window.
