questions.explanation: To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.

questions.question: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:
questions.answerA: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
questions.answerB: At all times.
questions.answerC: Only if a crossing guard is present.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: Decrease your speed as you approach an intersection with a yield sign. Prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians in the intersection or crossroad. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign if traffic conditions require it.

questions.question: In inclement weather, you should:
questions.answerB: Drive in a low gear.
questions.answerC: Steer and brake smoothly.
questions.explanation: When driving during unfavorable weather conditions, avoid slamming on the brakes and making sharp, quick turns. These behaviors will make controlling your vehicle in inclement weather even more difficult.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching an area with low clearance.

questions.question: If you are driving near a large commercial vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Follow the large vehicle closely to reduce wind drag on your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Avoid driving beside it for long stretches of time.
questions.answerC: Drive on its right side when on curves and hills.
questions.explanation: Because large commercial vehicles have large blind spots on each side, you should avoid driving beside them for long periods of time.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: No turning.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

questions.question: When parking uphill next to a curb, set the parking brake and:
questions.answerA: Keep the rear tires against the curb.
questions.answerB: Keep the front tires straight ahead.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel away from the curb.
questions.answerD: Turn your steering wheel toward the curb.
questions.explanation: When parking facing uphill on a street that has a curb, set your parking brake and turn your steering wheel away from the curb. This way, if your vehicle starts to roll, it will roll into the curb.

questions.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:
questions.answerA: Until after you pass the sign.
questions.answerB: Unless it seems safe to do so.
questions.answerC: For any reason.
questions.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

questions.question: If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should:
questions.answerB: Maintain your speed and position.
questions.answerC: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.
questions.explanation: Passing areas are based on how far ahead drivers can see. Allow the passing vehicle to re-enter the drive lane as easily as possible to help everyone avoid potential upcoming hazards.

questions.question: A pentagon-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerB: Regulatory sign.
questions.answerC: School zone or school crossing sign.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign is used to alert drivers to a school zone. Some pentagonal signs specifically indicate crosswalks within school zones where children or other pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerB: Regulatory sign.
questions.answerC: Warning sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: When driving on slippery roads, you should:
questions.answerB: Drive as you would on dry roads.
questions.answerC: Increase your following distance.
questions.explanation: On slippery roads, you should increase your following distance. It may take more time to stop your vehicle than it would under normal conditions.

questions.question: At an intersection with a stop sign, you should stop and:
questions.answerA: Check your rearview mirror for cars tailgating.
questions.answerB: Move when the vehicle ahead of you moves.
questions.answerC: Look right first, then left, then right again.
questions.answerD: Look left first, then right, then left again.
questions.explanation: When stopped at an intersection, you should first look to your left, as vehicles coming from the left are closer to you than vehicles coming from the right. Look to your right, then look to your left again, in case there are any vehicles coming from that direction that you did not see at first glance.

questions.question: What does a traffic signal with a yellow left arrow indicate?
questions.answerA: Drivers should prepare to yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: The protected left turn is about to end.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: When a protected turn arrow changes from green to yellow, drivers must prepare to yield to oncoming traffic. A yellow arrow indicates that the protected left turn is ending.

questions.question: What does alcohol do to your driving skills and judgement?
questions.answerA: It helps driving skills but harms your judgement.
questions.answerB: It harms both driving skills and judgement.
questions.answerC: It has no effect on either driving skills or judgement.
questions.answerD: It has no effect on judgement but it harms driving skills.
questions.explanation: Alcohol negatively affects many skills needed for safe driving, including your reaction time and ability to see clearly. It can also harm your judgment of speed and distance, lower your inhibitions, and make you more prone to taking chances.

questions.question: If a child is about to run into the street, you should:
questions.answerA: Start to prepare to slow down.
questions.answerB: Flash your headlights.
questions.answerC: Sound a sharp blast of your horn.
questions.explanation: If there is danger, you may need to sound a sharp blast on your horn. Do this when a child or any other pedestrian is about to enter into the street in front of your moving vehicle.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you should:
questions.answerB: Begin signaling as you move into the next lane.
questions.answerC: Signal at least 500 feet before your lane change when driving on residential streets.
questions.explanation: Other cars and motorcycles are often hidden in a vehicle’s blind spot, so be sure to glance over your shoulder before you begin a lane change. Begin signaling 100 feet before changing lanes or turning in a residential area. Signal five seconds in advance when changing lanes on a freeway.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: No outlet.
questions.answerC: No U-turns.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited. You may see a sign like this at an intersection that commonly has oncoming traffic.

questions.question: What is the appropriate action to take when approaching a railroad crossing that does not have signals to direct traffic?
questions.answerA: Always bring the car to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: Slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerC: All railroad crossings have signals so you will never encounter this situation.
questions.answerD: Increase your speed to get across the tracks quickly.
questions.explanation: When approaching an unmarked railroad crossing, slow down and be prepared to stop. Before you cross, be sure that no trains are approaching from either direction on any track. If you see or hear a train coming, stop at a safe distance from the nearest track and wait to proceed until after the train passes.

questions.question: When driving in a construction zone:
questions.answerB: Expect the unexpected.
questions.answerC: Expect construction workers to yield to motorists.
questions.explanation: You may encounter unexpected conditions in a construction zone. For the safety of yourself, other drivers, and construction workers, drive with extraordinary caution.

questions.question: A fully loaded tractor-trailer traveling at 55 mph could take up to ____ to come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: 125 feet
questions.answerC: 400 feet
questions.explanation: Tractor-trailers take longer distances to stop than smaller cars traveling at the same speed. A fully loaded tractor-trailer may take almost 400 feet to come to a complete stop when driving at 55 mph.

questions.question: Night driving can be more difficult than driving during the day because:
questions.answerA: Cars overheat more quickly at night.
questions.answerB: Visibility is reduced in the dark.
questions.answerC: It is more likely to be raining at night.
questions.answerD: You are more likely to encounter a motorcycle at night.
questions.explanation: At night, your field of vision is reduced. To make sure you are able to react to hazards on the roadway, always use appropriate headlights. Drive slowly enough that you are able to stop within the distance that you can see ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign is posted on one-way streets and other roadways where a driver is not allowed to enter. A driver may see this sign if attempting to enter an expressway ramp in the wrong direction.

questions.question: What happens if you drink alcohol while taking prescription or over-the-counter medicine?
questions.answerA: The medicine reduces the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerB: The alcohol will help the medicine cure a cold.
questions.answerC: The combination could multiply the effects of the alcohol or medicine.
questions.answerD: There is no effect because they are different substances.
questions.explanation: Consuming alcohol and other drugs together can increase the impairing effects of both. For example, having one drink while you are also using a cold remedy could affect you as much as several drinks would when being consumed separately from any medications.

questions.question: Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:
questions.answerB: Passenger vehicle.
questions.answerC: Motorcycle.
questions.explanation: Allow for extra space when driving behind a motorcycle. Motorcycles can stop more quickly than other vehicles can and you must have adequate room to stop if the motorcyclist brakes or falls off. Also, remember that motorcycles are difficult to see at night because they only have one tail light.

questions.question: You may drive across a dashed white line:
questions.answerB: Only during daylight hours.
questions.answerC: When it is safe to change lanes.
questions.explanation: Traffic lanes moving in the same direction are separated by broken white lines. You may cross over dashed lines to pass, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When driving in traffic, it is safest to:
questions.answerA: Fluctuate your speed to keep alert.
questions.answerB: Drive faster than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Drive slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerD: Drive with the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Crashes often happen when some drivers go faster or slower than other vehicles on the road. Always try to drive with the flow of traffic, within the posted speed limit.

questions.question: You must stop at an intersection when you see a:
questions.answerB: Steady yellow light.
questions.answerC: Yellow arrow.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic signal has the same meaning as a stop sign. At an intersection with a flashing red light, you must come to a complete stop, look both ways, and proceed only after the intersection is clear.

questions.question: Alcohol in any concentration is:
questions.answerB: A depressant.
questions.answerC: Neither of the above.
questions.explanation: Alcohol, in any concentration, is a depressant. It slows all nerve impulses and bodily functions, resulting in a lessening of inhibitions and negatively affecting a consumer's ability to concentrate and stay alert.

questions.question: Before turning, you should:
questions.answerB: Turn the wheel.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed.
questions.explanation: To complete a turn safely, you should activate your turn signal three to four seconds before your turn.

questions.question: The most important thing to remember about speed management and curves is that you must:
questions.answerA: Drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down at the sharpest part of the curve.
questions.answerB: Slow down before you enter the curve.
questions.answerC: Accelerate gently before you enter the curve.
questions.answerD: Drive at the posted speed limit before, throughout, and after the curve.
questions.explanation: The most important thing to remember about driving in curves is that your vehicle’s inertia may make it difficult to turn. To maintain control, it is essential that you slow down before entering the curve.

questions.question: The most effective safety restraints in a traffic crash are:
questions.answerA: Only a lap and shoulder belt.
questions.answerB: Only an airbag.
questions.answerC: Both a lap/shoulder belt and an airbag.
questions.explanation: Safety belts can double your chance of surviving a crash and more than double your chance of avoiding serious injury. Airbags, when used properly with safety belts, provide additional protection in a front-end crash. You should wear both shoulder and lap belts.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Double curve.
questions.answerC: Winding road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.

questions.question: You should honk your horn when you:
questions.answerB: Are passing a bicyclist.
questions.answerC: See a child who is about to run into the street.
questions.explanation: Your horn should be used as a warning in situations where you think another driver or a pedestrian does not see you. For example, if a child begins to run into the street in front of your vehicle, you should sound your horn.

questions.question: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:
questions.answerB: When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
questions.answerC: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

questions.question: Motorcycles, scooters, and mopeds are not easy to see; therefore, you should:
questions.answerB: Make constant visual checks.
questions.answerC: Share a lane with a motorcycle.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can be easily hidden in a vehicle’s blind spot or missed in a quick look due to their small size. Drivers of cars must always be alert and looking for motorcycles, mopeds, and scooters.

questions.question: You must stop at a railroad crossing when:
questions.answerA: Directed to do so by a flagger.
questions.answerB: It is controlled by a stop sign.
questions.answerC: Flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger or stop sign. Stop when flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.

questions.question: You come to an intersection with a flashing red light. You must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
questions.answerB: Turn either right or left, since the road is blocked ahead.
questions.answerC: Stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
questions.answerD: Stop at the intersection, then proceed as traffic allows.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means that you must come to a full stop, and then proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Merge.
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection with a side road ahead.

questions.question: A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
questions.answerB: Slow down.
questions.answerC: Speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.
questions.answerD: Stop and let the pedestrian cross.
questions.explanation: Slow down and be prepared to stop whenever you see pedestrians walking on or crossing the roadway. Be particularly careful where children are present. Always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian crossing in a crosswalk.

questions.question: The posted maximum speed limit is the fastest you can drive in an area.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: The posted maximum speed limit is the fastest legal driving speed in an area, under ideal conditions. You must reduce your speed when conditions require it, such as when the roadway is slippery or when it is difficult to see clearly down the road.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle downhill on a two-way street:
questions.answerA: Turn your wheels to the right.
questions.answerB: Turn your wheels to the left.
questions.answerC: Keep your wheels pointed straight ahead.
questions.explanation: When you park on a downward-facing slope, turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road. This way, if your vehicle starts to roll downhill, it will roll away from traffic.

questions.question: What can you do to reduce road rage?
questions.answerA: Always signal your intention when changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Talk on your cell phone while driving.
questions.answerC: Use your horn frequently.
questions.explanation: To do your part to prevent road rage, you should follow laws, signs, signals, and pavement markings. Always signal your intention when changing lanes.

questions.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:
questions.answerA: You cannot cross the line to pass.
questions.answerB: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If you become drowsy while driving, you should:
questions.answerB: Take a break.
questions.answerC: Take some caffeine pills.
questions.explanation: If you start to feel tired while driving, drive to the first available rest stop or service area to take a break, nap, stretch, or change drivers. You should not rely on caffeine pills or energy drinks, as these are not a replacement for rest and may make your driving even more dangerous.

questions.question: If you begin to feel tired while driving, the best thing to do is to:
questions.answerB: Open your window.
questions.answerC: Stop driving.
questions.explanation: Being fatigued while driving is similar in danger to driving under the influence of alcohol. If you begin to feel tired while driving, the best thing to do is to stop driving.

questions.question: Double solid yellow line markings down the center of a road indicate that passing is:
questions.answerB: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
questions.answerC: Not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A double yellow centerline means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the centerline to pass.

questions.question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
questions.answerB: Cough syrups and cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
questions.answerC: All of the above.
questions.explanation: A number of drugs can impair your ability to drive, including depressant medications like tranquilizers and sedatives; over-the-counter cough syrups, cold tablets, and allergy medications (which may contain impairing substances like alcohol, codeine, or antihistamines); and illegal drugs.

questions.question: A driver entering interstate traffic from an entrance or acceleration ramp:
questions.answerA: Should yield to drivers already on the interstate.
questions.answerB: Has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: May force their way into traffic.
questions.answerD: Can assume that other drivers will change lanes to make room.
questions.explanation: If you are on an entrance or acceleration ramp and are entering interstate traffic, you should yield to drivers already on the interstate highway. Merge safely into traffic when you are able to do so.

questions.question: When changing lanes on a highway, you should:
questions.answerB: Check your rearview and outside mirrors.
questions.answerC: Check your blind spot by glancing over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: Any time you want to change lanes, you should properly signal your intentions well in advance, check your mirrors, and check your blind spot. You can check your blind spot by glancing over your shoulder in the direction that you plan to move.

questions.question: In rainy weather, you should be most careful when turning or stopping:
questions.answerA: After it has been raining all day.
questions.answerB: One half hour after it stops raining.
questions.answerC: During the first half hour of rain.
questions.explanation: You should be extra careful when turning and stopping during the first half hour of rain. At this point, the oil from cars has not yet washed off the pavement and could be forming a slippery mixture with the rain.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers that:
questions.answerA: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
questions.answerB: The road curves ahead.
questions.answerC: There are upcoming intersections.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Divided highway starts.
questions.answerC: Divided highway ends.
questions.explanation: This sign warns drivers that the divided highway ends ahead.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
questions.answerA: They take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
questions.answerB: They all have air brakes that allow them to stop quickly.
questions.answerC: They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
questions.explanation: Large trucks take longer to stop than other vehicles traveling at the same speed. The average passenger vehicle traveling at 55 mph can stop within 400 feet. However, a large truck traveling at the same speed can take almost 800 feet to stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerB: U-turns are prohibited.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
questions.answerD: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: If you drive past these signs, you are going the wrong way and are at risk of a head-on collision. You should cautiously turn around.

questions.question: Your tire blows out while you are driving. You should:
questions.answerB: Hold your steering wheel tightly and slow to a stop.
questions.answerC: Keep driving normally.
questions.answerD: Turn on your emergency flashers and continue driving.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, do not immediately apply the brakes. Grip the steering wheel firmly and steer to remain in your traffic lane. Reduce your speed gradually by releasing the accelerator and staying off the brakes. Once you are moving very slowly, apply the brakes lightly and pull off the road into a safe area.

questions.question: If you have an argument with another person and you are angry, you should:
questions.answerA: Loudly play the radio while driving so you won’t think about your argument.
questions.answerB: Take a few minutes to cool off before driving.
questions.answerC: Drive on the interstate to let off steam.
questions.explanation: Your emotions affect your ability to drive safely. If you are overly angry, excited, afraid, worried, or depressed, you should give yourself time to calm down before operating a vehicle. You need to be able to mentally focus on driving without thinking about the things that made you upset.

questions.question: The sign indicates:
questions.answerB: An upcoming construction or maintenance area.
questions.answerC: A passing zone.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazards or special conditions. Construction areas are usually indicated by orange-colored warning signs.

questions.question: You may legally block an intersection:
questions.answerA: If you entered the intersection on the green light.
questions.answerB: During rush hour traffic.
questions.answerC: Under no circumstances.
questions.explanation: Even if the light is green, you may not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Jogging trail.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. You should watch for people entering a crosswalk or crossing your path. Slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn can be made here.
questions.answerB: A left turn can be made only after stopping.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate that the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
questions.answerA: Cross the tracks immediately and as quickly as possible.
questions.answerB: Always stop before crossing the tracks.
questions.answerC: Prepare to yield to any train at the crossing.
questions.answerD: Speed up to beat any oncoming train.
questions.explanation: Always be prepared to yield to any oncoming trains before crossing railroad tracks, particularly if there are no lights or gates controlling the crossing. Never start to cross the tracks until there is room for your entire vehicle on the other side of the tracks. Due to the risk of a vehicle stalling, it is not wise to shift gears when crossing railroad tracks.

questions.question: Motorcycles are entitled to:
questions.answerB: The same full lane width as other motor vehicles.
questions.answerC: Half the width of a lane.
questions.explanation: Lane usage for the motorcyclist is critical. Motorcycles are entitled to the same full lane width as all other vehicles.

questions.question: Why is double parking prohibited?
questions.answerA: The driver is illegally avoiding parking fees.
questions.answerB: It blocks traffic and causes accidents.
questions.answerC: Your car may roll into traffic.
questions.explanation: Double parking is when a driver parks on the roadway side of another vehicle that is already parked next to a curb. Double parking a vehicle is prohibited because it blocks traffic and may cause an accident.

questions.question: Your body gets rid of approximately:
questions.answerB: One alcoholic drink an hour.
questions.answerC: Two alcoholic drinks an hour.
questions.explanation: The average person’s body will process about one alcoholic drink in one hour. However, many factors play a part in determining how impaired a person will become when consuming alcohol, including the amount of alcohol consumed, how fast it is consumed, and a person’s body weight, food intake, and general health.

questions.question: Signaling your intentions before turning, changing lanes, or driving away from a curb:
questions.answerA: Is necessary only if other traffic is present.
questions.answerB: Is a good driving habit and is required by law.
questions.answerC: Is necessary only during the maneuver, not before.
questions.answerD: Is not necessary if the maneuver is done slowly.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes or turning, signal your intentions well in advance. The law requires that you signal for at least 100 feet before you move your vehicle to the right or left. Before pulling away from a curb, always signal to inform passing drivers of your intentions.

questions.question: It is unlawful for a car to try to share a lane with a motorcycle.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Motorcycle operators have the right to use a complete traffic lane. Two motorcyclists may share a lane, but a car should never try to share a lane with a motorcycle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Side road.
questions.answerC: Railroad ahead.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice:
questions.answerA: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.
questions.answerB: Maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.
questions.answerC: Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.
questions.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. You should also follow farther behind the vehicle in front of you than you normally would. Quick stops should be avoided. Unless you have antilock brakes, pump the brakes to slow or stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds a series of turns or curves.
questions.answerC: Traffic increases ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that pavement is slippery when wet. In wet conditions, you should reduce your speed, avoid braking or changing direction suddenly, and increase the distance between your vehicle and the one ahead.

questions.question: When driving past a vehicle that has just stopped in a parked position on the side of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Assume that the driver will open the car door as you approach.
questions.answerB: Speed up.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerD: Assume that the driver will wait for you to pass before opening the door.
questions.explanation: When passing a vehicle that has just parked parallel to the road, you should assume the driver will open the door as you approach. Use extra caution when driving near parked vehicles.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane ends, merge left.
questions.answerC: Turn around.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a roundabout is ahead. Enter a roundabout at a low speed and yield to existing traffic.

questions.question: What is the only way to reduce your blood alcohol concentration (BAC)?
questions.answerB: Exercise.
questions.answerC: Allow your body time to get rid of the alcohol.
questions.explanation: The only method that effectively reduces your BAC is to not drink alcohol for a period of time. Coffee, exercise, and cold showers cannot reduce your BAC or change the effects of alcohol. They can help you remain awake, but they cannot change your BAC or make you sober.

questions.question: In traffic moving at 50 to 55 mph, you are least likely to have an accident if you:
questions.answerA: Drive a few miles per hour faster than most other vehicles.
questions.answerB: Stay within that speed range.
questions.answerC: Drive a few miles per hour slower than most other vehicles.
questions.explanation: You should adjust your speed to travel smoothly with the other traffic on a roadway (provided that the other traffic is driving within the posted speed limits). Remember that vehicles moving in the same direction at the same speed cannot hit each other. Crashes involving multiple vehicles often happen when some vehicles are traveling at different speeds than others.

questions.question: On a green arrow, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield to pedestrians only in the intersection.
questions.answerC: Wait four seconds before proceeding.
questions.explanation: A green arrow means "go." You must turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

questions.question: In the District of Columbia, if you are traveling on a one-way street and you want to make a left turn onto another one-way street, it is illegal to make a left turn on a red traffic signal.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: It is illegal to make a left turn on a red traffic signal in the District of Columbia. You may make a right turn on a red traffic light where permitted.
